page.title: 02Farming
page.content: Although the Ordnance Survey lists 14 farms in this area only 4 remain as working farms,ranging from Downley Farm of 173 acres,worked by the 3 Hounslow brothers as tenant farmers for 46 years,to the Dashwood-Kent partnership,formed in 1981,of 1800 acres centred on Cookshall Farm but including much land in surrounding "D" blocks. The D-K farms have 1100 breeding ewes with 40 Suffolk rams from which they obtain 2000 lambs for fat lamb production while Downley Farm's 22 ewes produce lambs for the meat market with the help of a hired ram!The fleeces from both farms are taken to the Wool Staplers (Pearce) in Thame, the centre for the collection of fleeces for the whole of southern and south-western England.Here they are graded and sold to woollen factories.
